Text.Value: Please let this work...

EditorData.NodeContext: Kind of to herself

Text.Value: Let me sleep on it. I just might be able to work something out.
I wish it could. I really, really do. Look after yourself, all right?

EditorData.NodeContext: Sadly

Text.Value: Find me again in Baldur's Gate. If I'm worth my salt, I'll have figured something out by then.
I wasn't making any headway with the mechanics - none at all. The environment here is just too cold to sustain metals like the ones inside you.
Same as last time - you'll need to install it yourself. But this should do the trick.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Choices][Dammon] hands the upgrade to Karlach [Karlach] fiddles with the upgrade near her chest
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Dammon hands the upgrade to Karlach (beneath camera) and Karlach fiddles with it near her chest area (not shown - shot from behind, maybe?). Mechanical clinking and grinding as she fits it in.
EditorData.SFXTags: [EG] Karlach pushing metallic upgrade into her engine on her chest, lots of tinkering/steam/clicking

Text.Value: I don't know what to say.
...I am sorry, Karlach. Truly I am. But come - it is not a decision you must make this moment.

EditorData.NodeContext: Just heard that Karlach cannot be cured and will have to return to Avernus or die. Not trying to soften the blow or lie to her - just expressisng genuine sympathy and trying to help her focus on the path forward.

Text.Value: I get that. But don't rule it out. The world just might be better with you in it - even in Avernus.
Only one way to find out.
We'll have to make the inevitable evitable, then.
Then again, I do love a challenge. Could be if the combustion chamber had its own insulation, or if the spark plug had a dampener... I'll give it some thought.
Mm. The weight of it. And that blaze of chaos. Can't imagine this where my heart should be. Must be quite the experience.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Karlach hands off the metal to Dammon (off screen), and he takes it (off screen - this can stay bronze). He holds it, enjoying the power of it.
EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This branch is also in DEN_ForgingOfTheHeart_OM_KArlach_COM (N27)

Text.Value: Same as last time - you'll need to install it yourself. But this should do the trick.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Choices][Dammon] hands the upgrade to Karlach [Karlach] fiddles with the upgrade near her chest
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Dammon hands the upgrade to Karlach (beneath camera) and Karlach fiddles with it near her chest area (not shown - shot from behind, maybe?). Mechanical clinking and grinding as she fits it in.
EditorData.SFXTags: [EG] Karlach pushing metallic upgrade into her engine on her chest, lots of tinkering/steam/clicking

Text.Value: There. So did it... work?

EditorData.NodeContext: A little nervous

Text.Value: Incredible.
Find me again in Baldur's Gate. If I'm worth my salt, I'll have figured something out by then.
We are all dust or ash in the end. Make your enemies burn while your heart still beats, and it will be a good life, no matter how brief.

EditorData.NodeContext: slightly mournful but pragmatic - this is Minthara's idea of a pep talk for a terminally ill companion. Delivered sincerely.

Text.Value: Hold on, Karlach. There's something I need to tell you.
Give me just a moment... and I think...

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: He forges the metal (CINE NOTE: See HAV_TieflingSurvivors_Weaponsmith, which already has animations for this that we can use here)
EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This branch is also in DEN_ForgingOfTheHeart_OM_KArlach_COM (N92)

Text.Value: The minute I set foot back in Avernus, Zariel will force me back into service. I'm not doing her bidding again. I'd rather die.
I wasn't making any headway with the mechanics - none at all. The environment here is just too cold to sustain metals like the ones inside you.
Thank you.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Choices][Player] pull her into a hug [Karlach] hugs player strongly, her face buried in your neck as she begins to cry.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: She hugs you strongly, her face buried in your neck as she begins to cry.
EditorData.NodeContext: Overwhelmed with emotion

Text.Value: Well - all right. This shouldn't take long.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Choices]*REUSE*[Karlach][Dammon] may reuse construction or existing custom
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
Karlach hands off the metal to Dammon (off screen), and he takes it (off screen - this can stay bronze).

He forges the metal (CINE NOTE: See HAV_TieflingSurvivors_Weaponsmith, which already has animations for this that we can use here)
EditorData.NodeContext: A little wary/ sad, because he has bad news for Karlach.

Text.Value: The minute I set foot back in Avernus, Zariel will force me back into service. I'm not doing her bidding again. I'd rather die.
That feels... good. I'm still burning hot as Hell's hole, but I feel less... changeable. Cheers, mate.
Damn. I'm good. And you - you're very touchable.
Pause. Is he flirting with you?
Still haven't lost it, after all these years. Thanks, Dammon.
Thank you.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Choices]*DUPE*[Player] pull her into a hug [Karlach] hugs player strongly, her face buried in your neck as she begins to cry.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: She hugs you strongly, her face buried in your neck as she begins to cry.
EditorData.NodeContext: Overwhelmed with emotion

Text.Value: Damn. I'm good. And you - you're very touchable.
A warrior of your talents does not need looking after. You only need the next battle, then the next, then the next.
Isn't there anything you can do?
I won't stop trying to figure out a cure, but... at this point, I think I might be beaten.
That engine wasn't meant for this realm, though. And I'm not sure how much longer it's going to last, burning that hot.
Before you go - there's something I need to tell you.
I get that. But don't rule it out. The world just might be better with you in it - even in Avernus.
Take your leave - you have someone you really want to touch.
Go on. Give us your hand.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Choices][Dammon][Karlach] Dammon holds up his hand. Karlach holds hers up to his, their palms touching.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Dammon holds up his hand. Karlach holds hers up to his, their palms touching.
EditorData.SFXTags: [EG] Karlach pushing metallic upgrade into her engine on her chest, lots of tinkering/steam/clicking

Text.Value: It's the least I could do.
Right? All this doom and gloom. I have something far more exciting on my mind than this bloody tin box.

EditorData.NodeContext: A little uncertain. She means what she's saying but also papering over the weight of what she's just heard.

Text.Value: There. You'll have to install it, I'm afraid. I don't think there are thick enough gloves in all the realms to protect from that kind of heat.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Choices]*DUPE*[Dammon] hands the upgrade to Karlach [Karlach] fiddles with the upgrade near her chest
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Dammon hands the upgrade to Karlach (beneath camera) and Karlach fiddles with it near her chest area (not shown - shot from behind, maybe?). Mechanical clinking and grinding as she fits it in.
EditorData.SFXTags: [EG] Karlach pushing metallic upgrade into her engine on her chest, lots of tinkering/steam/clicking

Text.Value: Me either.
Let me sleep on it. I just might be able to work something out.
I can tune it up, but whether I can stop it from burning out is... up to the gods. That thing just wasn't meant to last in the Material Plane.
You feel so nice.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Choices][Player] put their hand on her shoulder [Karlach] inclines her head toward their hand and chokes up a little
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: She inclines her head toward your hand and chokes up a little.
EditorData.NodeContext: Choking up

Text.Value: You have to return to Avernus - for good - or this thing is going to burn you up from the inside out. And sooner than you think.
Hopefully the next time I see you, I'll have something promising to report. I'll need more infernal iron either way, though, so keep your eyes open. Take care.
That engine of yours - it's contained for the moment, but it's just too hot to exist here in the material plane indefinitely.
You feel so nice.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Choices]*DUPE*[Player] put their hand on her shoulder [Karlach] inclines her head toward their hand and chokes up a little
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: She inclines her head toward your hand and chokes up a little.
EditorData.NodeContext: Choking up

Text.Value: The minute I set foot back in Avernus, Zariel will force me back into service. I'm not doing her bidding again. I'd rather die.
Can we go to bed now?

EditorData.NodeContext:
Still crying but kinda making herself laugh too.
NOTE TO DIRECTOR:
We had to change the text of this line for gameplay reasons, but we really loved the original take and would like to reference it for hte re-record.
For reference, the original line's  UUID: h8605b090gbf19g43e5gb56fgaea68974604d

"Can we go to camp now?"

Text.Value: Thank you, Dammon.
Yeah. Apart from the doom and gloom, you've given me more than I could ever hope to repay.
Together, we are mightier than even the fires of Avernus. We will overcome, Karlach - I promise you.
Thanks, Dammon. Really. You've given me more than I could ever repay.
Ahem - look, Karlach, there's something I need to tell you.
It's been my pleasure. Good luck - both of you. Look after yourself, all right?
You're going to let a bit of iron beat you?!
I can't say. I don't think anyone can. But when it's coming... you'll know.
Leave.
Come on, Karlach. There's got to be more to this - some other way.
I won't stop trying to figure out a cure, but... at this point, I think we all have to face the inevitable.
Lay a hand on her.
Thank you, Dammon. I can't tell you what this means to me.
Give me just a moment... and I think...

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: He forges the metal (CINE NOTE: See HAV_TieflingSurvivors_Weaponsmith, which already has animations for this that we can use here)
EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This branch is also in DEN_ForgingOfTheHeart_OM_KArlach_COM (N92)

Text.Value: Leave.
I hope you're right, and I hope I'm wrong.
An all-too-familiar tale. I refuse to believe we cannot alter the ending.

EditorData.NodeContext: Determination (thinking of the parallels between Karlach's dilemma and his own)

Text.Value: Say nothing. You're still trying to process what you've heard.
Mm. The weight of it. And that blaze of chaos. Can't imagine this where my heart should be. Must be quite the experience.
Ignot. Look at that. No fire.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Choices][Player] stand stock still [Karlach] reaches out and grasps the player's shoulder.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: She reaches out and grasps the player's shoulder.
EditorData.NodeContext: Good-humored. She's calling you a weirdo. 'IG-not'

Text.Value: That isn't true. Anything can be beaten.
Before you go - there's something I need to tell you.
How long do I have?
It's not any old iron, Karlach. This stuff belongs in the Hells, and unless it's taken back there, it's going to blow. No amount of tinkering is going to change that.
I know you know that, but the thing is, there's a cure.
Nothing is inevitable. Especially not this.
I can't believe it. Thank you, Dammon. Thank you so much.

EditorData.NodeContext: Verklempt.

Text.Value: You're all right. No burns.

EditorData.NodeContext: When she speaks (after the kiss) she has tears in her eyes and his verklempt

Text.Value: My pleasure. Before you go - there's something I need to tell you.
Pull her into a hug.
First things first. Karlach, you have touch back. We ought to celebrate that.
That feels... good. I'm still burning hot as Hell's hole, but I feel less... changeable. Cheers, mate.
I know you know that, but the thing is, there's a cure.
Mm. The weight of it. And that blaze of chaos. Can't imagine this where my heart should be. Must be quite the experience.
Good luck, Karlach. Look after yourself, all right?
Hopefully the next time I see you, I'll have something promising to report. I'll need more infernal iron either way, though, so keep your eyes open. Take care.
Well - all right. This shouldn't take long.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Choices]*REUSE*[Karlach][Dammon] may reuse construction or existing custom
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
Karlach hands off the metal to Dammon (off screen), and he takes it (off screen - this can stay bronze).

He forges the metal (CINE NOTE: See HAV_TieflingSurvivors_Weaponsmith, which already has animations for this that we can use here)
EditorData.NodeContext: A little wary/ sad, because he has bad news for Karlach.
EditorData.SFXTags: [EG] Infernal metal clinking during passover, Hammer on metal

Text.Value: You look good, too. Enjoy it - after spending time in Avernus, I know better than most that you deserve a good turn.
Kiss her.
Ignot. Look at that. No fire.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Choices]*DUPE*[Player] stand stock still [Karlach] reaches out and grasps the player's shoulder.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: She reaches out and grasps the player's shoulder.
EditorData.NodeContext: Good-humored. She's calling you a weirdo. 'IG-not'

Text.Value: You're all right. No burns.

EditorData.NodeContext: When she speaks (after the kiss) she has tears in her eyes and his verklempt

Text.Value: Well, that's... not great?
Thank you - I feel... good.
Pleasure. And as for the heat, I haven't got any solutions now, but I'm not giving up. Could be if the combustion chamber had its own insulation, or if we had some kind of enchanted coolant...
Pleasure. And as for the heat, I haven't got any solutions now, but I'm not giving up. Could be if the combustion chamber had its own insulation, or if we had some kind of enchanted coolant...
You have to return to Avernus - for good - or this thing is going to burn you up from the inside out. And sooner than you think.
There. You'll have to install it, I'm afraid. I don't think there are thick enough gloves in all the realms to protect from that kind of heat.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Choices]*DUPE*[Dammon] hands the upgrade to Karlach [Karlach] fiddles with the upgrade near her chest
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Dammon hands the upgrade to Karlach (beneath camera) and Karlach fiddles with it near her chest area (not shown - shot from behind, maybe?). Mechanical clinking and grinding as she fits it in.
EditorData.SFXTags: [EG] Karlach pushing metallic upgrade into her engine on her chest, lots of tinkering/steam/clicking

Text.Value: I'm still burning just as hot as ever.
So bright a warrior needs no looking after. But... Boo and I will have her back, just in case.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bravado for a fellow warrior he respects - second line a gentler affirmation that she'll be missed when she's gone

Text.Value: Stand stock still.
That engine of yours - it's contained for the moment, but it's just too hot to exist here in the material plane indefinitely.
Take care, Karlach. And hopefully the next time I see you, I'll have something promising to report. Pocket any infernal iron you find along the way, hmm?
Her will is strong - even now, she defies the bounds of the material plane. She will prevail.
Hold on, Karlach. There's something I need to tell you.
You read my mind.

EditorData.NodeContext: Mischievous

Text.Value: Please let this work...

EditorData.NodeContext: Kind of to herself

Synopsis: Nested dialog used for Karlach upgrades in Dammon's default dialogues.
